title: Tourist left with broken tooth after chomping down on glass during £5k dream African holiday plagued with constant banging from construction
text:
Opinion 'IT TOOK MY FILLING OUT' Tourist left with broken tooth after chomping down on glass during £5k dream African holiday plagued with constant banging from construction 
David James said he could barely wait to get off the island Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A HOLIDAYMAKER was left horrified after chomping down on GLASS in his buffet meal, accusing a travel company of leaving his beach getaway in ruins. 
David James said his relaxing holiday at the Riu Toureg hotel in Boa Vista descended into chaos– finding faeces in the pool twice in two days, the calming spa ruined by nearby construction and being given uncooked meat at the restaurant. David James David James damaged his filling after crunching down on glass in his holiday meal David James 5 David and wife Julie said their holiday that cost almost £5,000 was extremely disappointing 
The furious traveller told The Sun Online he believed the tour company Thomson had marketed the holiday under false pretences, saying: “Apart from the individual issues that I have had, it’s the fact that a reputable company can say something about a destination that just isn’t true.” 
He said that the holiday getaway met its first obstacle when their flight was delayed for a day, meaning that they missed out on one of 14 days planned. 
But on arrival, he said travellers were met with a rusty bus to take them to the five star hotel, where he and wife Julie were given the wrong room. David James 5 The couple said the serenity was ruined by constant construction works 
Told that he could make a complaint after lunch, he said the couple then went to the restaurant on the hotel, which sits on Cape Verde off the coast of west Africa. 
He said: “We went to the restaurant on the first day and I ate a fork of pasta – crunch. 
“I spat the food out and there was glass. It took my filling out.” 
He said that he had been offered help to book a dental appointment at the island but wanted to wait until arriving back home in the UK. 
The management consultant, who works in construction, said the couple had been warned about ongoing construction in the area but had been assured it would not be near their rooms. 
But instead, Mr James said every time he looked out of his hotel window, he had a view of the construction and heard a constant banging when he tried to go to the spa. 
The West Midlands local said: “I work in construction – the last thing I want to see or hear is building works.” RELATED STORIES STRANDED IN PARADISE Cape Verde holidaymakers stuck on tropical island over Christmas after dust cloud made it impossible to fly home 'IT RUINED THE HOLIDAY' Paraplegic forced to wash in SINK after Thomson failed to secure wheelchair-friendly room 'WANNA SWIM IN THE SEA? FORGET IT' Tourists’ fury after booking dream beach holiday only to discover the sea is too dangerous to swim in – with holidaymakers breaking BONES DATES FOR THE DIARY Here is how the date of Easter Sunday is decided - and when the holidays fall this year PENSIONS AT RISK Millions could lose a fortune under new loophole to allow firms in trouble a 'pensions holiday' 
He added that the food at the restaurant was regularly uncooked, finding raw pork was being served to customers at the buffet. 
He said: “I’m not a snob but if I pay for something, I expect to get that service. 
“The hotel says it is five star but it’s three star, if that.” 
The 56-year-old, who spent almost £5,000 on the holiday in August last year, said he had been trying to flag his concerns with the company but it still hadn’t been resolved. David James
